sect1.title: Download Client
sect1.para: The final system build does not install an FTP or HTTP client for downloading files.

listitem.para: BASH - A user can use net redirections (if not disabled when building bash in the final system) to download wget or another program.

screen.userinput:
cat > download.sh << "EOF" #!/bin/bash
WGET_VERSION='1.14' WGET_HOSTNAME='ftp.gnu.org' exec {HTTP_FD}<>/dev/tcp/${WGET_HOSTNAME}/80 echo -ne "GET /gnu/wget/wget-${WGET_VERSION}.tar.xz HTTP/1.1
Host: "\ ${WGET_HOSTNAME}'
User-Agent: '\ 'bash/'${BASH_VERSION}'

' >&${HTTP_FD} sed -e '1,/^.$/d' <&${HTTP_FD} >wget-${WGET_VERSION}.tar.xz EOF

listitem.para: PERL with HTTP::Tiny (Included with final system PERL install).

screen.userinput: perl -MHTTP::Tiny -E 'say HTTP::Tiny->new->get(shift)->{content}' "http://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/wget/wget-1.14.tar.xz" > binary perl -e 'local $/; $_ = <>; s/\n$//; print' binary > wget-1.14.tar.xz rm binary

listitem.para: PERL with LWP: Run cpan and manually configure the client. Run install LWP while in the CPAN shell.
